DataElement.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body of a rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomic sites.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomical sites.

Concepts.definition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomic sites.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.4.12 Took out of retirement and cleaned up. ak 2022.10.13 Retired per Thalia Beeles of COG. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomical sites._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unfavorable site, >5cm,  and/or regional node involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unfavorable site, >5cm,  and/or regional node involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unfavorable site, >5cm,  and/or regional node involvement

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unfavorable site, <= 5 cm, no regional node involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unfavorable site, <= 5 cm, no regional node involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unfavorable site, <= 5 cm, no regional node involvement

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
